message:
The feeling of descalation?
The French news agency reports that the airlines Air France and Transavia will resume their flights to Beirut tomorrow.

The Lebanese Ministry of Health with official data on the war:

547 dead and 1,765 wounded in Lebanon since the beginning of the war.

Over 100 thousand people were evacuated from their homes in Lebanon.

The Lebanese Al Mayadeen (identified with the "Axis of the Resistance") from a senior source in the "Resistance":

Hamas will not take part in the talks on the ceasefire in Doha (Qatar) tomorrow.
Lebanese sources: Movement of displaced Lebanese towards the west of Beirut and towards the Baalbek district due to the fear of Israeli attacks on Hezbollah strongholds in Beirut's Dahieh.

Afghanistan: The Taliban is holding a military parade today at the Bagram base - which was the largest American air base in Afghanistan.

American military equipment also appears in the parade...

The parade on the occasion of the anniversary "of the liberation of Afghanistan from the American occupier".
One of the IDF jeeps that was hit by an IED in Tubas this morning.

Iranian revenge and Hezbollah's revenge - a brief snapshot

We are now on the 14th day since the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran and since the Iranian announcement of "revenge against Israel". This year, the Iranians always took revenge by the 12th day after hoisting the revenge flags...

The Americans are throwing all their weight behind preventing regional escalation and are deploying military forces on an unprecedented scale: aircraft carriers, submarines, tens of thousands of soldiers and much more. At the same time, last night's report on the approval of a large arms deal in the amount of 20 billion dollars and the announcement by the Western countries of their commitment to the defense of Israel - are doing their part. It certainly deters Iran and Hezbollah.

In addition, today the US is sending special envoy Amos Hochstein to Beirut, at the same time as a broad diplomatic effort aimed at Thursday - negotiations on a ceasefire deal in Gaza.
The Iranians already sound less determined than before regarding revenge. The public announcements are more hesitant.

It is evident that everyone is waiting with eager anticipation for the results of the round of negotiations on Thursday and the Biden administration really wants it to succeed this time - this will surely also bring unprecedented pressure on Israel behind the scenes.

The big danger is that the greater the expectation from the negotiations, the greater the disappointment if the round does not succeed.

The operation in Tubas and Tamun:
The Palestinians report that the IDF forces are in possession of three bodies of Palestinians who were killed as a result of the (first ever) Israeli aircraft attack in Tamun.
Lebanon: Lebanese channels claim that tonight Israeli warplanes fired shots over the airfield in Beirut and over the Dahieh area.
Brazil neighborhood in Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip - the erasure of buildings.

The IDF spokesman published an infographic of the location from which Hamas launched rockets towards Tel Aviv yesterday.

The launch was made from Khan Yunis right inside the humanitarian route through which the aid trucks pass from the south of the strip to the center and north.

The IDF spokesman reported that the IDF attacked the area from which the launches were carried out yesterday.

Gaza Strip:
The Palestinians report 12 deaths tonight in two IDF attacks in the Maghazi refugee camp in the center of the Gaza Strip:
8 killed in the attack on the house of the Abu Nada family.
4 killed in the attack on the Eid family home.

It was also reported that two more were killed in the attack on the Mazin family home in Beit Lahia in the north of the Gaza Strip.
Palestinian channels report that in the early morning the PA's security mechanisms detonated, in a controlled manner, an explosive device that was planted to hit IDF forces in Jenin.

The IDF announced a military operation in Tubas and Tamun in northern Samaria

Before this morning's announcement of the operation, IDF forces surrounded a building in Tubas where terrorist Faiz Dagharma - a released prisoner - was hiding. The Palestinians reported that the forces fired shoulder-fired missiles and even attacked from the air in the area of ​​the house. He was eliminated and apparently others were arrested.
During the exchange of fire in Tubas, Palestinian terrorists detonated explosive devices at the forces.

The US approved an arms deal worth about 20 billion dollars to Israel.

The deal includes:
Air-to-air missiles worth $102.5 million.
Tank shells worth 774 million dollars.
Tactical vehicles worth $583 million.
F-15s worth $18.8 billion.

The Lebanese Al Mayadeen channel: The American base in the Koniko gas field in Syria was attacked by rockets.

According to other sources, 4 Grad rockets were fired at the base.

##
The Pentagon admitted this evening that 8 American soldiers were injured last week in an unmanned aerial vehicle attack on an American base in Syria.

Ahmed Abd al-Hadi, Hamas representative in Lebanon in an interview with the Russian news agency RIA Novosti:
We will not participate in the Gaza ceasefire talks, scheduled for Thursday.

Hebron: Reports of two Palestinians injured in an explosion that happened last night inside a vehicle in the Haska area in the northwest of Hebron.

The circumstances of the explosion are being investigated.
